attributes.action: Extend the Stamp Duty threshold, so that it covers all house purchases.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Stamp Duty threshold currently stands at £125,000 However should  wish to purchase a property at £249,000 you will be required to pay stamp duty at 1% on the total amount of the purchase price. I believe that the government should only be charging stamp duty at 1% on £124,000. The first £125,000 should be free of duty on all house purchases no matter what value of the property.
If you take income tax as an example, if you fall into the 40% tax bracket, you don't pay 40% on your total earnings you still have your personal tax allowance.

Also review the current stamp duty scales 1%,3% & 4%. When I went to school there used to be 2 between 1 and 3

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
